JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mykhaylo Buromenskiy;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the town of GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE criminal proceedings were instituted against the applicant in connection with several straightforward episodes of smuggling goods to GPE .
CARDINAL . In the period from DATE to CARDINAL DATE criminal proceedings were instituted against PERSON , PERSON and CARDINAL other persons in connection with the same episodes .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant gave a written undertaking not to abscond .

CARDINAL . On DATE , while undergoing a course of treatment in a hospital , the applicant was arrested and remained under arrest in the hospital . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant finished his treatment . On DATE he was placed in custody .
CARDINAL . On DATE the proceedings against the applicant , PERSON and PERSON were joined .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was transferred to ORG for examination . On DATE it sentenced the applicant to DATE and DATE imprisonment .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed that judgment and remitted the case for fresh consideration to ORG On DATE the ORG sentenced the applicant to DATE , DATE imprisonment . Since the applicant had already spent an equivalent time in prison he was considered to have served his sentence . By the same judgment the court placed the applicant under an obligation not to abscond . On DATE the applicant was released .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of DATE and remitted the case to the prosecutor 's office for further investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the further investigation was completed and the case was transferred to the GPE ORG of GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP ORG of Zaporizhzhya sentenced him to DATE imprisonment . The applicant was exempted from serving his sentence under LAW . By the same judgment the court released the applicant from the undertaking not to abscond .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , acting as a court of appeal , upheld that judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the ruling of DATE and remitted the case for fresh consideration to the court of appeal since the latter had failed to consider the applicant 's appeal in a due manner .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of Appeal quashed the judgment of DATE and remitted the case for further investigation to the prosecutor 's office .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was transferred to the GPE ORG of GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE ORG of GPE terminated the criminal proceedings against the applicant since the charges against him had become time - barred . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE ORG and ORG , respectively , upheld that ruling .
